Package org.radarbase.management.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
org.radarbase.management.service.UserService
@Service @Transactional public class UserService extends Object
Service class for managing users.

      public UserService()

  • Method Details

    • activateRegistration

      public Optional<User> activateRegistration(String key)
      Activate a user with the given activation key.
      Parameters:
      key - the activation key
      Returns:
      an Optional which is populated with the activated user if the registration key was found, and is empty otherwise.

    • completePasswordReset

      public Optional<User> completePasswordReset(String newPassword, String key)
      Update a user password with a given reset key.
      Parameters:
      newPassword - the updated password
      key - the reset key
      Returns:
      an Optional which is populated with the user whose password was reset if the reset key was found, and is empty otherwise

    • requestActivationReset

      public Optional<User> requestActivationReset(String login)
      Find the deactivated user and set the user's reset key to a new random value and set their reset date to now. Note: We do not use activation key for activating an account. It happens by resetting generated password. Resetting activation is by resetting reset-key and reset-date to now.
      Parameters:
      login - the login of the user
      Returns:
      an Optional which holds the user if an deactivated user was found with the given login, and is empty otherwise

    • requestPasswordReset

      public Optional<User> requestPasswordReset(String mail)
      Set a user's reset key to a new random value and set their reset date to now.
      Parameters:
      mail - the email address of the user
      Returns:
      an Optional which holds the user if an activated user was found with the given email address, and is empty otherwise

    • createUser

      public User createUser(UserDTO userDto) throws org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException
      Add a new user to the database.

      The new user will not be activated and have a random password assigned. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure the new user has a means of activating their account.

      Parameters:
      userDto - the user information
      Returns:
      the newly created user
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(String userName, String firstName, String lastName, String email, String langKey)
      Update basic information (first name, last name, email, language) for the current user.
      Parameters:
      firstName - first name of user
      lastName - last name of user
      email - email id of user
      langKey - language key

    • updateUser

      @Transactional public Optional<UserDTO> updateUser(UserDTO userDto) throws org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException
      Update all information for a specific user, and return the modified user.
      Parameters:
      userDto - user to update
      Returns:
      updated user
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String login)
      Delete the user with the given login.
      Parameters:
      login - the login to delete

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String password)
      Change the password of the user with the given login.
      Parameters:
      password - the new password

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String login, String password)
      Change the user's password.
      Parameters:
      password - the new password
      login - of the user to change password

    • getAllManagedUsers

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<UserDTO> getAllManagedUsers(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Get a page of users.
      Parameters:
      pageable - the page information
      Returns:
      the requested page of users

    • getUserWithAuthoritiesByLogin

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public Optional<UserDTO> getUserWithAuthoritiesByLogin(String login)
      Get the user with the given login.
      Parameters:
      login - the login
      Returns:
      an Optional which holds the user if one was found with the given login, and is empty otherwise

    • getUserWithAuthorities

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public Optional<User> getUserWithAuthorities()
      Get the current user.
      Returns:
      the currently authenticated user, or null if no user is currently authenticated

    • removeNotActivatedUsers

      @Scheduled(cron="0 0 1 * * ?") public void removeNotActivatedUsers()
      Not activated users should be automatically deleted after 3 days.

      This is scheduled to get fired everyday, at 01:00 (am). This is aimed at users, not subjects. So filter our users with *PARTICIPANT role and perform the action.

    • findUsers

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<UserDTO> findUsers(UserFilter userFilter, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, boolean includeProvenance)
      Find all user with given filter.
      Parameters:
      userFilter - filtering for users.
      pageable - paging information
      includeProvenance - whether to include created and modification fields.
      Returns:
      page of users.

    • updateRoles

      @Transactional public void updateRoles(String login, Set<RoleDTO> roleDtos) throws org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException
      Update the roles of the given user.
      Parameters:
      login - user login
      roleDtos - new roles to set
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException - if the current user is not allowed to modify the roles of the target user.
